label: submitted to insdc
definition: Depending on the study (large-scale e.g. done with next generation sequencing technology, or small-scale) sequences have to be submitted to SRA (Sequence Read Archive), DRA (DDBJ Read Archive) or via the classical Webin/Sequin systems to Genbank, ENA and DDBJ. Although this field is mandatory, it is meant as a self-test field, therefore it is not necessary to include this field in contextual data submitted to databases

label: investigation type
definition: Nucleic Acid Sequence Report is the root element of all MIGS/MIMS compliant reports as standardized by Genomic Standards Consortium. This field is either eukaryote,bacteria,virus,plasmid,organelle, metagenome,mimarks-survey, mimarks-specimen, metatranscriptome, single amplified genome, metagenome-assembled genome, or uncultivated viral genome
expectedValue: eukaryote, bacteria_archaea, plasmid, virus, organelle, metagenome,mimarks-survey, mimarks-specimen, metatranscriptome, single amplified genome, metagenome-assembled genome, or uncultivated viral genomes

label: project name
definition: Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized

label: experimental factor
definition: Experimental factors are essentially the variable aspects of an experiment design which can be used to describe an experiment, or set of experiments, in an increasingly detailed manner. This field accepts ontology terms from Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) and/or Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI). For a browser of EFO (v 2.95) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/EFO; for a browser of OBI (v 2018-02-12) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI

label: geographic location (latitude and longitude)
definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude and longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

label: geographic location (country and/or sea,region)
definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea name followed by specific region name. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html), or the GAZ ontology (v 1.512) (http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/GAZ)
expectedValue: country or sea name (INSDC or GAZ);region(GAZ);specific location name

label: collection date
definition: The time of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008; Except: 2008-01; 2008 all are ISO8601 compliant

label: broad-scale environmental context
definition: In this field, report which major environmental system your sample or specimen came from. The systems identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. were you in the desert or a rainforest?). We recommend using subclasses of ENVO’s biome class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. Format (one term): termLabel [termID], Format (multiple terms): termLabel [termID]|termLabel [termID]|termLabel [termID]. Example: Annotating a water sample from the photic zone in middle of the Atlantic Ocean, consider: oceanic epipelagic zone biome [ENVO:01000033]. Example: Annotating a sample from the Amazon rainforest consider: tropical moist broadleaf forest biome [ENVO:01000228]. If needed, request new terms on the ENVO tracker, identified here: http://www.obofoundry.org/ontology/envo.html
expectedValue: Add terms that identify the major environment type(s) where your sample was collected. Recommend subclasses of biome [ENVO:00000428]. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes e.g.: mangrove biome [ENVO:01000181]|estuarine biome [ENVO:01000020]

label: local environmental context
definition: In this field, report the entity or entities which are in your sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. Please use terms that are present in ENVO and which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for env_broad_scale. Format (one term): termLabel [termID]; Format (multiple terms): termLabel [termID]|termLabel [termID]|termLabel [termID]. Example: Annotating a pooled sample taken from various vegetation layers in a forest consider: canopy [ENVO:00000047]|herb and fern layer [ENVO:01000337]|litter layer [ENVO:01000338]|understory [01000335]|shrub layer [ENVO:01000336]. If needed, request new terms on the ENVO tracker, identified here: http://www.obofoundry.org/ontology/envo.html
expectedValue: Add terms that identify environmental entities having causal influences upon the entity at time of sampling, multiple terms can be separated by pipes, e.g.: shoreline [ENVO:00000486]|intertidal zone [ENVO:00000316]

label: environmental medium
definition: In this field, report which environmental material or materials (pipe separated) immediately surrounded your sample or specimen prior to sampling, using one or more subclasses of ENVO’s environmental material class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483. Format (one term): termLabel [termID]; Format (multiple terms): termLabel [termID]|termLabel [termID]|termLabel [termID]. Example: Annotating a fish swimming in the upper 100 m of the Atlantic Ocean, consider: ocean water [ENVO:00002151]. Example: Annotating a duck on a pond consider: pond water [ENVO:00002228]|air ENVO_00002005. If needed, request new terms on the ENVO tracker, identified here: http://www.obofoundry.org/ontology/envo.html
expectedValue: Add terms that identify the material displaced by the entity at time of sampling. Recommend subclasses of environmental material [ENVO:00010483]. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes e.g.: estuarine water [ENVO:01000301]|estuarine mud [ENVO:00002160]

label: environmental package
definition: MIxS extension for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from one or more of the environments where the sample was obtained. All environmental packages listed here are further defined in separate subtables. By giving the name of the environmental package, a selection of fields can be made from the subtables and can be reported

label: subspecific genetic lineage
definition: This should provide further information about the genetic distinctness of the sequenced organism by recording additional information e.g. serovar, serotype, biotype, ecotype, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group I plasmid. It can also contain alternative taxonomic information. It should contain both the lineage name, and the lineage rank, i.e. biovar:abc123
expectedValue: genetic lineage below lowest rank of NCBI taxonomy, which is subspecies, e.g. serovar, biotype, ecotype

label: ploidy
definition: The ploidy level of the genome (e.g. allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid). It has implications for the downstream study of duplicated gene and regions of the genomes (and perhaps for difficulties in assembly). For terms, please select terms listed under class ploidy (PATO:001374) of Phenotypic Quality Ontology (PATO), and for a browser of PATO (v 2018-03-27) please refer to http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO

label: number of replicons
definition: Reports the number of replicons in a nuclear genome of eukaryotes, in the genome of a bacterium or archaea or the number of segments in a segmented virus. Always applied to the haploid chromosome count of a eukaryote
expectedValue: for eukaryotes and bacteria: chromosomes (haploid count); for viruses: segments

label: extrachromosomal elements
definition: Do plasmids exist of significant phenotypic consequence (e.g. ones that determine virulence or antibiotic resistance). Megaplasmids? Other plasmids (borrelia has 15+ plasmids)

label: estimated size
definition: The estimated size of the genome prior to sequencing. Of particular importance in the sequencing of (eukaryotic) genome which could remain in draft form for a long or unspecified period.

label: reference for biomaterial
definition: Primary publication if isolated before genome publication; otherwise, primary genome report

label: source material identifiers
definition: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample (as defined by http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/materialSampleID, and as opposed to a particular digital record of a material sample) used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field. For instance, the /specimen_voucher qualifier and source_mat_id may both contain 'UAM:Herps:14' , referring to both the specimen voucher and sampled tissue with the same identifier. However, the /culture_collection qualifier may refer to a value from an initial culture (e.g. ATCC:11775) while source_mat_id would refer to an identifier from some derived culture from which the nucleic acids were extracted (e.g. xatc123 or ark:/2154/R2).
expectedValue: for cultures of microorganisms: identifiers for two culture collections; for other material a unique arbitrary identifer

label: known pathogenicity
definition: To what is the entity pathogenic
expectedValue: names of organisms that the entity is pathogenic to

label: observed biotic relationship
definition: Description of relationship(s) between the subject organism and other organism(s) it is associated with. E.g., parasite on species X; mutualist with species Y. The target organism is the subject of the relationship, and the other organism(s) is the object

label: specific host
definition: If there is a host involved, please provide its taxid (or environmental if not actually isolated from the dead or alive host - i.e. a pathogen could be isolated from a swipe of a bench etc) and report whether it is a laboratory or natural host)

label: host specificity or range
definition: The NCBI taxonomy identifier of the specific host if it is known

label: health or disease status of specific host at time of collection
definition: Health or disease status of specific host at time of collection

label: trophic level
definition: Trophic levels are the feeding position in a food chain. Microbes can be a range of producers (e.g. chemolithotroph)

label: propagation
definition: This field is specific to different taxa. For phages: lytic/lysogenic, for plasmids: incompatibility group, for eukaryotes: sexual/asexual (Note: there is the strong opinion to name phage propagation obligately lytic or temperate, therefore we also give this choice
expectedValue: for virus: lytic, lysogenic, temperate, obligately lytic; for plasmid: incompatibility group; for eukaryote: asexual, sexual

label: encoded traits
definition: Should include key traits like antibiotic resistance or xenobiotic degradation phenotypes for plasmids, converting genes for phage
expectedValue: for plasmid: antibiotic resistance; for phage: converting genes

label: relationship to oxygen
definition: Is this organism an aerobe, anaerobe? Please note that aerobic and anaerobic are valid descriptors for microbial environments

label: isolation and growth condition
definition: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID (pmid), digital object identifier (doi) or url for isolation and growth condition specifications of the organism/material

label: sample collection device or method
definition: The method or device employed for collecting the sample

label: sample material processing
definition: Any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment. This field accepts OBI, for a browser of OBI (v 2018-02-12) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI
example: filtering of seawater, storing samples in ethanol

label: size fraction selected
definition: Filtering pore size used in sample preparation

label: amount or size of sample collected
definition: Amount or size of sample (volume, mass or area) that was collected

label: source of UViGs
definition: Type of dataset from which the UViG was obtained
valueSyntax: [metagenome (not viral targeted)|viral fraction metagenome (virome)|sequence-targeted metagenome|metatranscriptome (not viral targeted)|viral fraction RNA metagenome (RNA virome)|sequence-targeted RNA metagenome|microbial single amplified genome (SAG)|viral single amplified genome (vSAG)|isolate microbial genome|other]

label: virus enrichment approach
definition: List of approaches used to enrich the sample for viruses, if any
valueSyntax: [filtration|ultrafiltration|centrifugation|ultracentrifugation|PEG Precipitation|FeCl Precipitation|CsCl density gradient|DNAse|RNAse|targeted sequence capture|other|none]

label: nucleic acid extraction
definition: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the material separation to recover the nucleic acid fraction from a sample

label: nucleic acid amplification
definition: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the enzymatic amplification (PCR, TMA, NASBA) of specific nucleic acids

label: library size
definition: Total number of clones in the library prepared for the project

label: library reads sequenced
definition: Total number of clones sequenced from the library

label: library layout
definition: Specify whether to expect single, paired, or other configuration of reads

label: library vector
definition: Cloning vector type(s) used in construction of libraries

label: library screening strategy
definition: Specific enrichment or screening methods applied before and/or after creating libraries

label: target gene
definition: Targeted gene or locus name for marker gene studies

label: target subfragment
definition: Name of subfragment of a gene or locus. Important to e.g. identify special regions on marker genes like V6 on 16S rRNA

label: pcr primers
definition: PCR primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. This field should contain all the primers used for a single PCR reaction if multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction. The primer sequence should be reported in uppercase letters
expectedValue: FWD: forward primer sequence;REV:reverse primer sequence

label: multiplex identifiers
definition: Molecular barcodes, called Multiplex Identifiers (MIDs), that are used to specifically tag unique samples in a sequencing run. Sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

label: adapters
definition: Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported; in uppercase letters

label: pcr conditions
definition: Description of reaction conditions and components of PCR in the form of 'initial denaturation:94degC_1.5min; annealing=...'

label: sequencing method
definition: Sequencing method used; e.g. Sanger, pyrosequencing, ABI-solid
valueSyntax: [MinION|GridION|PromethION|454 GS|454 GS 20|454 GS FLX|454 GS FLX+|454 GS FLX Titanium|454 GS Junior|Illumina Genome Analyzer|Illumina Genome Analyzer II|Illumina Genome Analyzer IIx|Illumina HiSeq 4000|Illumina HiSeq 3000|Illumina HiSeq 2500|Illumina HiSeq 2000|Illumina HiSeq 1500|Illumina HiSeq 1000|Illumina HiScanSQ|Illumina MiSeq|Illumina HiSeq X Five|Illumina HiSeq X Ten|Illumina NextSeq 500|Illumina NextSeq 550|AB SOLiD System|AB SOLiD System 2.0|AB SOLiD System 3.0|AB SOLiD 3 Plus System|AB SOLiD 4 System|AB SOLiD 4hq System|AB SOLiD PI System|AB 5500 Genetic Analyzer|AB 5500xl Genetic Analyzer|AB 5500xl-W Genetic Analysis System|Ion Torrent PGM|Ion Torrent Proton|Ion Torrent S5|Ion Torrent S5 XL|PacBio RS|PacBio RS II|Sequel|AB 3730xL Genetic Analyzer|AB 3730 Genetic Analyzer|AB 3500xL Genetic Analyzer|AB 3500 Genetic Analyzer|AB 3130xL Genetic Analyzer|AB 3130 Genetic Analyzer|AB 310 Genetic Analyzer|BGISEQ-500]

label: sequence quality check
definition: Indicate if the sequence has been called by automatic systems (none) or undergone a manual editing procedure (e.g. by inspecting the raw data or chromatograms). Applied only for sequences that are not submitted to SRA,ENA or DRA

label: chimera check
definition: A chimeric sequence, or chimera for short, is a sequence comprised of two or more phylogenetically distinct parent sequences. Chimeras are usually PCR artifacts thought to occur when a prematurely terminated amplicon reanneals to a foreign DNA strand and is copied to completion in the following PCR cycles. The point at which the chimeric sequence changes from one parent to the next is called the breakpoint or conversion point
expectedValue: name and version of software, parameters used

label: taxonomic identity marker
definition: The phylogenetic marker(s) used to assign an organism name to the SAG or MAG

label: assembly quality
definition: The assembly quality category is based on sets of criteria outlined for each assembly quality category. For MISAG/MIMAG; Finished: Single, validated, contiguous sequence per replicon without gaps or ambiguities with a consensus error rate equivalent to Q50 or better. High Quality Draft:Multiple fragments where gaps span repetitive regions. Presence of the 23S, 16S and 5S rRNA genes and at least 18 tRNAs. Medium Quality Draft:Many fragments with little to no review of assembly other than reporting of standard assembly statistics. Low Quality Draft:Many fragments with little to no review of assembly other than reporting of standard assembly statistics. Assembly statistics include, but are not limited to total assembly size, number of contigs, contig N50/L50, and maximum contig length. For MIUVIG; Finished: Single, validated, contiguous sequence per replicon without gaps or ambiguities, with extensive manual review and editing to annotate putative gene functions and transcriptional units. High-quality draft genome: One or multiple fragments, totaling ≥ 90% of the expected genome or replicon sequence or predicted complete. Genome fragment(s): One or multiple fragments, totalling < 90% of the expected genome or replicon sequence, or for which no genome size could be estimated
valueSyntax: [Finished genome|High-quality draft genome|Medium-quality draft genome|Low-quality draft genome|Genome fragment(s)]

label: assembly name
definition: Name/version of the assembly provided by the submitter that is used in the genome browsers and in the community

label: assembly software
definition: Tool(s) used for assembly, including version number and parameters
expectedValue: name and version of software, parameters used

label: annotation
definition: Tool used for annotation, or for cases where annotation was provided by a community jamboree or model organism database rather than by a specific submitter
expectedValue: name of tool or pipeline used, or annotation source description

label: number of contigs
definition: Total number of contigs in the cleaned/submitted assembly that makes up a given genome, SAG, MAG, or UViG

label: feature prediction
definition: Method used to predict UViGs features such as ORFs, integration site, etc.
expectedValue: names and versions of software(s), parameters used

label: reference database(s)
definition: List of database(s) used for ORF annotation, along with version number and reference to website or publication
expectedValue: names, versions, and references of databases

label: similarity search method
definition: Tool used to compare ORFs with database, along with version and cutoffs used
expectedValue: names and versions of software(s), parameters used

label: taxonomic classification
definition: Method used for taxonomic classification, along with reference database used, classification rank, and thresholds used to classify new genomes
expectedValue: classification method, database name, and other parameters
example: vConTACT vContact2 (references from NCBI RefSeq v83, genus rank classification, default parameters)

label: 16S recovered
definition: Can a 16S gene be recovered from the submitted SAG or MAG?

label: 16S recovery software
definition: Tools used for 16S rRNA gene extraction
expectedValue: names and versions of software(s), parameters used

label: number of standard tRNAs extracted
definition: The total number of tRNAs identified from the SAG or MAG

label: tRNA extraction software
definition: Tools used for tRNA identification
expectedValue: names and versions of software(s), parameters used

label: completeness score
definition: Completeness score is typically based on either the fraction of markers found as compared to a database or the percent of a genome found as compared to a closely related reference genome. High Quality Draft: >90%, Medium Quality Draft: >50%, and Low Quality Draft: < 50% should have the indicated completeness scores

label: completeness software
definition: Tools used for completion estimate, i.e. checkm, anvi'o, busco
expectedValue: names and versions of software(s) used

label: completeness approach
definition: The approach used to determine the completeness of a given SAG or MAG, which would typically make use of a set of conserved marker genes or a closely related reference genome. For UViG completeness, include reference genome or group used, and contig feature suggesting a complete genome
example: other: UViG length compared to the average length of reference genomes from the P22virus genus (NCBI RefSeq v83)

label: contamination score
definition: The contamination score is based on the fraction of single-copy genes that are observed more than once in a query genome. The following scores are acceptable for; High Quality Draft: < 5%, Medium Quality Draft: < 10%, Low Quality Draft: < 10%. Contamination must be below 5% for a SAG or MAG to be deposited into any of the public databases

label: contamination screening input
definition: The type of sequence data used as input

label: contamination screening parameters
definition: Specific parameters used in the decontamination sofware, such as reference database, coverage, and kmers. Combinations of these parameters may also be used, i.e. kmer and coverage, or reference database and kmer

label: decontamination software
definition: Tool(s) used in contamination screening

label: sorting technology
definition: Method used to sort/isolate cells or particles of interest

label: single cell or viral particle lysis approach
definition: Method used to free DNA from interior of the cell(s) or particle(s)

label: single cell or viral particle lysis kit protocol
definition: Name of the kit or standard protocol used for cell(s) or particle(s) lysis

label: WGA amplification approach
definition: Method used to amplify genomic DNA in preparation for sequencing

label: WGA amplification kit
definition: Kit used to amplify genomic DNA in preparation for sequencing

label: binning parameters
definition: The parameters that have been applied during the extraction of genomes from metagenomic datasets

label: binning software
definition: Tool(s) used for the extraction of genomes from metagenomic datasets

label: reassembly post binning
definition: Has an assembly been performed on a genome bin extracted from a metagenomic assembly?

label: MAG coverage software
definition: Tool(s) used to determine the genome coverage if coverage is used as a binning parameter in the extraction of genomes from metagenomic datasets

label: viral identification software
definition: Tool(s) used for the identification of UViG as a viral genome, software or protocol name including version number, parameters, and cutoffs used
expectedValue: software name, version and relevant parameters

label: predicted genome type
definition: Type of genome predicted for the UViG

label: predicted genome structure
definition: Expected structure of the viral genome

label: detection type
definition: Type of UViG detection

label: vOTU classification approach
definition: Cutoffs and approach used when clustering new UViGs in “species-level” vOTUs. Note that results from standard 95% ANI / 85% AF clustering should be provided alongside vOTUS defined from another set of thresholds, even if the latter are the ones primarily used during the analysis

label: vOTU sequence comparison approach
definition: Tool and thresholds used to compare sequences when computing "species-level" vOTUs
expectedValue: software name, version and relevant parameters

label: vOTU database
definition: Reference database (i.e. sequences not generated as part of the current study) used to cluster new genomes in "species-level" vOTUs, if any

label: host prediction approach
definition: Tool or approach used for host prediction

label: host prediction estimated accuracy
definition: For each tool or approach used for host prediction, estimated false discovery rates should be included, either computed de novo or from the literature
example: CRISPR spacer match: 0 or 1 mismatches, estimated 8% FDR at the host genus rank (Edwards et al. 2016 doi:10.1093/femsre/fuv048)

label: relevant standard operating procedures
definition: Standard operating procedures used in assembly and/or annotation of genomes, metagenomes or environmental sequences

label: elevation
definition: Elevation of the sampling site is its height above a fixed reference point, most commonly the mean sea level. Elevation is mainly used when referring to points on the earth's surface, while altitude is used for points above the surface, such as an aircraft in flight or a spacecraft in orbit

label: altitude
definition: Altitude is a term used to identify heights of objects such as airplanes, space shuttles, rockets, atmospheric balloons and heights of places such as atmospheric layers and clouds. It is used to measure the height of an object which is above the earth‚Äôs surface. In this context, the altitude measurement is the vertical distance between the earth's surface above sea level and the sampled position in the air

label: elevation
definition: Elevation of the sampling site is its height above a fixed reference point, most commonly the mean sea level. Elevation is mainly used when referring to points on the earth's surface, while altitude is used for points above the surface, such as an aircraft in flight or a spacecraft in orbit

label: geographic location (depth)
definition: Depth is defined as the vertical distance below local surface, e.g. For sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples

label: barometric pressure
definition: Force per unit area exerted against a surface by the weight of air above that surface

label: carbon dioxide
definition: Carbon dioxide (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

label: carbon monoxide
definition: Carbon monoxide (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

label: humidity
definition: Amount of water vapour in the air, at the time of sampling

label: methane
definition: Methane (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

label: organism count
definition: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr)

label: oxygen
definition: Oxygen (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

label: pollutants
definition: Pollutant types and, amount or concentrations measured at the time of sampling; can report multiple pollutants by entering numeric values preceded by name of pollutant

label: respirable particulate matter
definition: Concentration of substances that remain suspended in the air, and comprise mixtures of organic and inorganic substances (PM10 and PM2.5); can report multiple PM's by entering numeric values preceded by name of PM

label: sample salinity
definition: Salinity is the total concentration of all dissolved salts in a liquid or solid (in the form of an extract obtained by centrifugation) sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater

label: sample storage temperature
definition: Temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80 degree Celsius

label: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
definition: Volume (ml), weight (g) of processed sample, or surface area swabbed from sample for DNA extraction

label: solar irradiance
definition: The amount of solar energy that arrives at a specific area of a surface during a specific time interval
example: 1.36 kilowatts per square meter per day

label: temperature
definition: Temperature of the sample at the time of sampling

label: ventilation rate
definition: Ventilation rate of the system in the sampled premises

label: volatile organic compounds
definition: Concentration of carbon-based chemicals that easily evaporate at room temperature; can report multiple volatile organic compounds by entering numeric values preceded by name of compound

label: sample storage duration
definition: Duration for which the sample was stored

label: wind speed
definition: Speed of wind measured at the time of sampling

label: dissolved oxygen
definition: Concentration of dissolved oxygen

label: glucosidase activity
definition: Measurement of glucosidase activity

label: dissolved organic nitrogen
definition: Dissolved organic nitrogen concentration measured as; total dissolved nitrogen - NH4 - NO3 - NO2

label: aminopeptidase activity
definition: Measurement of aminopeptidase activity

label: bacterial carbon production
definition: Measurement of bacterial carbon production

label: biomass
definition: Amount of biomass; should include the name for the part of biomass measured, e.g. Microbial, total. Can include multiple measurements

label: bishomohopanol
definition: Concentration of bishomohopanol

label: bromide
definition: Concentration of bromide

label: chlorophyll
definition: Concentration of chlorophyll

label: diether lipids
definition: Concentration of diether lipids; can include multiple types of diether lipids

label: dissolved hydrogen
definition: Concentration of dissolved hydrogen

label: phaeopigments
definition: Concentration of phaeopigments; can include multiple phaeopigments

label: phospholipid fatty acid
definition: Concentration of phospholipid fatty acids; can include multiple values

label: redox potential
definition: Redox potential, measured relative to a hydrogen cell, indicating oxidation or reduction potential

label: salinity
definition: Salinity is the total concentration of all dissolved salts in a water sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater

label: silicate
definition: Concentration of silicate

label: water content
definition: Water content measurement

label: turbidity
definition: Measure of the amount of cloudiness or haziness in water caused by individual particles

label: water current
definition: Measurement of magnitude and direction of flow within a fluid

label: particle classification
definition: Particles are classified, based on their size, into six general categories:clay, silt, sand, gravel, cobbles, and boulders; should include amount of particle preceded by the name of the particle type; can include multiple values

label: sewage type
definition: Type of wastewater treatment plant as municipial or industrial

label: ancestral data
definition: Information about either pedigree or other ancestral information description (e.g. parental variety in case of mutant or selection), e.g. A/3*B (meaning [(A x B) x B] x B)

label: gastrointestinal tract disorder
definition: History of gastrointestinal tract disorders; can include multiple disorders

label: nose/mouth/teeth/throat disorder
definition: History of nose/mouth/teeth/throat disorders; can include multiple disorders

label: dermatology disorder
definition: History of dermatology disorders; can include multiple disorders

label: carbon/nitrogen ratio
definition: Ratio of amount or concentrations of carbon to nitrogen

label: pre-treatment
definition: The process of pre-treatment removes materials that can be easily collected from the raw wastewater

label: primary treatment
definition: The process to produce both a generally homogeneous liquid capable of being treated biologically and a sludge that can be separately treated or processed

label: reactor type
definition: Anaerobic digesters can be designed and engineered to operate using a number of different process configurations, as batch or continuous, mesophilic, high solid or low solid, and single stage or multistage

label: secondary treatment
definition: The process for substantially degrading the biological content of the sewage

label: tertiary treatment
definition: The process providing a final treatment stage to raise the effluent quality before it is discharged to the receiving environment

label: wastewater type
definition: The origin of wastewater such as human waste, rainfall, storm drains, etc.

label: alkyl diethers
definition: Concentration of alkyl diethers

label: mean friction velocity
definition: Measurement of mean friction velocity

label: mean peak friction velocity
definition: Measurement of mean peak friction velocity

label: n-alkanes
definition: Concentration of n-alkanes; can include multiple n-alkanes

label: nitrogen
definition: Concentration of nitrogen (total)

label: phosphate
definition: Concentration of phosphate

label: organic carbon
definition: Concentration of organic carbon

label: organic matter
definition: Concentration of organic matter

label: organic nitrogen
definition: Concentration of organic nitrogen

label: particulate organic carbon
definition: Concentration of particulate organic carbon

label: petroleum hydrocarbon
definition: Concentration of petroleum hydrocarbon

label: total carbon
definition: Total carbon content

label: total nitrogen content
definition: Total nitrogen content of the sample

label: total organic carbon
definition: Definition for soil: total organic carbon content of the soil, definition otherwise: total organic carbon content

label: air temperature regimen
definition: Information about treatment involving an exposure to varying temperatures; should include the temperature, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include different temperature regimens

label: antibiotic regimen
definition: Information about treatment involving antibiotic administration; should include the name of antibiotic, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple antibiotic regimens
expectedValue: antibiotic name;antibiotic amount;treatment interval and duration

label: chemical mutagen
definition: Treatment involving use of mutagens; should include the name of mutagen, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple mutagen regimens
expectedValue: mutagen name;mutagen amount;treatment interval and duration

label: fertilizer regimen
definition: Information about treatment involving the use of fertilizers; should include the name of fertilizer, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple fertilizer regimens
expectedValue: fertilizer name;fertilizer amount;treatment interval and duration

label: fungicide regimen
definition: Information about treatment involving use of fungicides; should include the name of fungicide, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple fungicide regimens
expectedValue: fungicide name;fungicide amount;treatment interval and duration

label: gaseous environment
definition: Use of conditions with differing gaseous environments; should include the name of gaseous compound, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple gaseous environment regimens
expectedValue: gaseous compound name;gaseous compound amount;treatment interval and duration

label: gravity
definition: Information about treatment involving use of gravity factor to study various types of responses in presence, absence or modified levels of gravity; treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple treatments
expectedValue: gravity factor value;treatment interval and duration

label: growth hormone regimen
definition: Information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of growth hormone, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple growth hormone regimens
expectedValue: growth hormone name;growth hormone amount;treatment interval and duration

label: herbicide regimen
definition: Information about treatment involving use of herbicides; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of herbicide, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens
expectedValue: herbicide name;herbicide amount;treatment interval and duration

label: host wet mass
definition: Measurement of wet mass

label: humidity regimen
definition: Information about treatment involving an exposure to varying degree of humidity; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include amount of humidity administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens

label: light regimen
definition: Information about treatment(s) involving exposure to light, including both light intensity and quality.

label: mineral nutrient regimen
definition: Information about treatment involving the use of mineral supplements; should include the name of mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple mineral nutrient regimens
expectedValue: mineral nutrient name;mineral nutrient amount;treatment interval and duration

label: non-mineral nutrient regimen
definition: Information about treatment involving the exposure of plant to non-mineral nutrient such as oxygen, hydrogen or carbon; should include the name of non-mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple non-mineral nutrient regimens
expectedValue: non-mineral nutrient name;non-mineral nutrient amount;treatment interval and duration

label: pesticide regimen
definition: Information about treatment involving use of insecticides; should include the name of pesticide, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple pesticide regimens
expectedValue: pesticide name;pesticide amount;treatment interval and duration

label: radiation regimen
definition: Information about treatment involving exposure of plant or a plant part to a particular radiation regimen; should include the radiation type, amount or intensity administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple radiation regimens
expectedValue: radiation type name;radiation amount;treatment interval and duration

label: rainfall regimen
definition: Information about treatment involving an exposure to a given amount of rainfall, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens

label: rooting medium carbon
definition: Source of organic carbon in the culture rooting medium; e.g. sucrose.

label: rooting medium macronutrients
definition: Measurement of the culture rooting medium macronutrients (N,P, K, Ca, Mg, S); e.g. KH2PO4 (170¬†mg/L).

label: rooting medium micronutrients
definition: Measurement of the culture rooting medium micronutrients (Fe, Mn, Zn, B, Cu, Mo); e.g. H3BO3 (6.2¬†mg/L).

label: rooting medium organic supplements
definition: Organic supplements of the culture rooting medium, such as vitamins, amino acids, organic acids, antibiotics activated charcoal; e.g. nicotinic acid (0.5¬†mg/L).

label: rooting medium regulators
definition: Growth regulators in the culture rooting medium such as cytokinins, auxins, gybberellins, abscisic acid; e.g. 0.5¬†mg/L NAA.

label: salt regimen
definition: Information about treatment involving use of salts as supplement to liquid and soil growth media; should include the name of salt, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple salt regimens
expectedValue: salt name;salt amount;treatment interval and duration

label: water temperature regimen
definition: Information about treatment involving an exposure to water with varying degree of temperature, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens

label: watering regimen
definition: Information about treatment involving an exposure to watering frequencies, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens

label: total depth of water column
definition: Measurement of total depth of water column

label: biochemical oxygen demand
definition: Amount of dissolved oxygen needed by aerobic biological organisms in a body of water to break down organic material present in a given water sample at certain temperature over a specific time period

label: chemical oxygen demand
definition: A measure of the capacity of water to consume oxygen during the decomposition of organic matter and the oxidation of inorganic chemicals such as ammonia and nitrite

label: efficiency percent
definition: Percentage of volatile solids removed from the anaerobic digestor

label: emulsions
definition: Amount or concentration of substances such as paints, adhesives, mayonnaise, hair colorants, emulsified oils, etc.; can include multiple emulsion types

label: gaseous substances
definition: Amount or concentration of substances such as hydrogen sulfide, carbon dioxide, methane, etc.; can include multiple substances

label: industrial effluent percent
definition: Percentage of industrial effluents received by wastewater treatment plant

label: inorganic particles
definition: Concentration of particles such as sand, grit, metal particles, ceramics, etc.; can include multiple particles

label: organic particles
definition: Concentration of particles such as faeces, hairs, food, vomit, paper fibers, plant material, humus, etc.

label: sludge retention time
definition: The time activated sludge remains in reactor

label: soluble inorganic material
definition: Concentration of substances such as ammonia, road-salt, sea-salt, cyanide, hydrogen sulfide, thiocyanates, thiosulfates, etc.

label: soluble organic material
definition: Concentration of substances such as urea, fruit sugars, soluble proteins, drugs, pharmaceuticals, etc.

label: bacterial production
definition: Bacterial production in the water column measured by isotope uptake
example: 5 milligram per cubic meter per day

label: bacterial respiration
definition: Measurement of bacterial respiration in the water column
example: 300 micromole oxygen per liter per hour

label: total phosphate
definition: Total amount or concentration of phosphate

label: conductivity
definition: Electrical conductivity of water

label: dissolved inorganic nitrogen
definition: Concentration of dissolved inorganic nitrogen

label: downward PAR
definition: Visible waveband radiance and irradiance measurements in the water column
example: 28.71 microEinstein per square meter per second

label: fluorescence
definition: Raw or converted fluorescence of water

label: light intensity
definition: Measurement of light intensity

label: particulate organic nitrogen
definition: Concentration of particulate organic nitrogen

label: photon flux
definition: Measurement of photon flux
example: 3.926 micromole photons per second per square meter

label: primary production
definition: Measurement of primary production, generally measured as isotope uptake
example: 100 milligram per cubic meter per day

label: size-fraction lower threshold
definition: Refers to the mesh/pore size used to pre-filter/pre-sort the sample. Materials larger than the size threshold are excluded from the sample

label: size-fraction upper threshold
definition: Refers to the mesh/pore size used to retain the sample. Materials smaller than the size threshold are excluded from the sample

label: soluble reactive phosphorus
definition: Concentration of soluble reactive phosphorus

label: suspended particulate matter
definition: Concentration of suspended particulate matter

label: total dissolved nitrogen
definition: Total dissolved nitrogen concentration, reported as nitrogen, measured by: total dissolved nitrogen = NH4 + NO3NO2 + dissolved organic nitrogen

label: total inorganic nitrogen
definition: Total inorganic nitrogen content

label: total particulate carbon
definition: Total particulate carbon content

label: chemical administration
definition: List of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. Antibiotics, n fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For chemical entities of biological interest ontology (chebi) (v 163), http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/chebi

label: miscellaneous parameter
definition: Any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here
example: Bicarbonate ion concentration;2075 micromole per kilogram

label: oxygenation status of sample
definition: Oxygenation status of sample

label: perturbation
definition: Type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with perturbation regimen including how many times the perturbation was repeated, how long each perturbation lasted, and the start and end time of the entire perturbation period; can include multiple perturbation types
expectedValue: perturbation type name;perturbation interval and duration

label: sample storage location
definition: Location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

label: ventilation type
definition: Ventilation system used in the sampled premises

label: wind direction
definition: Wind direction is the direction from which a wind originates

label: surface material
definition: Surface materials at the point of sampling

label: menarche
definition: Date of most recent menstruation

label: hydrocarbon resource type
definition: Main Hydrocarbon Resource type. The term "Hydrocarbon Resource" HCR defined as a natural environmental feature containing large amounts of hydrocarbons at high concentrations potentially suitable for commercial exploitation. This term should not be confused with the Hydrocarbon Occurrence term which also includes hydrocarbon-rich environments with currently limited commercial interest such as seeps, outcrops, gas hydrates etc. If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
valueSyntax: [Oil Reservoir|Gas Reservoir|Oil Sand|Coalbed|Shale|Tight Oil Reservoir|Tight Gas Reservoir|other]

label: biotic regimen
definition: Information about treatment(s) involving use of biotic factors, such as bacteria, viruses or fungi.
example: sample inoculated with Rhizobium spp. Culture

label: climate environment
definition: Treatment involving an exposure to a particular climate; treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple climates

label: culture rooting medium
definition: Name or reference for the hydroponic or in vitro culture rooting medium; can be the name of a commonly used medium or reference to a specific medium, e.g. Murashige and Skoog medium. If the medium has not been formally published, use the rooting medium descriptors.

label: growth facility
definition: Type of facility where the sampled plant was grown; controlled vocabulary: growth chamber, open top chamber, glasshouse, experimental garden, field. Alternatively use Crop Ontology (CO) terms, see http://www.cropontology.org/ontology/CO_715/Crop%20Research

label: growth habit
definition: Characteristic shape, appearance or growth form of a plant species

label: mechanical damage
definition: Information about any mechanical damage exerted on the plant; can include multiple damages and sites

label: pH regimen
definition: Information about treatment involving exposure of plants to varying levels of ph of the growth media, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimen

label: plant growth medium
definition: Specification of the media for growing the plants or tissue cultured samples, e.g. soil, aeroponic, hydroponic, in vitro solid culture medium, in vitro liquid culture medium. Recommended value is a specific value from EO:plant growth medium (follow this link for terms http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/EO_0007147) or other controlled vocabulary

label: plant product
definition: Substance produced by the plant, where the sample was obtained from

label: plant sex
definition: Sex of the reproductive parts on the whole plant, e.g. pistillate, staminate, monoecieous, hermaphrodite.

label: plant structure
definition: Name of plant structure the sample was obtained from; for Plant Ontology (PO) (v releases/2017-12-14) terms, see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PO, e.g. petiole epidermis (PO_0000051). If an individual flower is sampled, the sex of it can be recorded here.

label: rooting conditions
definition: Relevant rooting conditions such as field plot size, sowing density, container dimensions, number of plants per container.

label: rooting medium pH
definition: pH measurement of the culture rooting medium; e.g. 5.5.

label: rooting medium solidifier
definition: Specification of the solidifying agent in the culture rooting medium; e.g. agar.

label: seasonal environment
definition: Treatment involving an exposure to a particular season (e.g. Winter, summer, rabi, rainy etc.), treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment
expectedValue: seasonal environment name;treatment interval and duration

label: standing water regimen
definition: Treatment involving an exposure to standing water during a plant's life span, types can be flood water or standing water, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens
expectedValue: standing water type;treatment interval and duration

label: tissue culture growth media
definition: Description of plant tissue culture growth media used

label: sediment type
definition: Information about the sediment type based on major constituents

label: tidal stage
definition: Stage of tide

label: current land use
definition: Present state of sample site
valueSyntax: [cities|farmstead|industrial areas|roads/railroads|rock|sand|gravel|mudflats|salt flats|badlands|permanent snow or ice|saline seeps|mines/quarries|oil waste areas|small grains|row crops|vegetable crops|horticultural plants (e.g. tulips)|marshlands (grass,sedges,rushes)|tundra (mosses,lichens)|rangeland|pastureland (grasslands used for livestock grazing)|hayland|meadows (grasses,alfalfa,fescue,bromegrass,timothy)|shrub land (e.g. mesquite,sage-brush,creosote bush,shrub oak,eucalyptus)|successional shrub land (tree saplings,hazels,sumacs,chokecherry,shrub dogwoods,blackberries)|shrub crops (blueberries,nursery ornamentals,filberts)|vine crops (grapes)|conifers (e.g. pine,spruce,fir,cypress)|hardwoods (e.g. oak,hickory,elm,aspen)|intermixed hardwood and conifers|tropical (e.g. mangrove,palms)|rainforest (evergreen forest receiving >406 cm annual rainfall)|swamp (permanent or semi-permanent water body dominated by woody plants)|crop trees (nuts,fruit,christmas trees,nursery trees)]

label: atmospheric data
definition: Measurement of atmospheric data; can include multiple data

label: liver disorder
definition: History of liver disorders; can include multiple disorders

label: sexual activity
definition: Current sexual partner and frequency of sex

label: current vegetation
definition: Vegetation classification from one or more standard classification systems, or agricultural crop

label: surface-air contaminant
definition: Contaminant identified on surface

label: biological status
definition: The level of genome modification

label: time since last toothbrushing
definition: Specification of the time since last toothbrushing

label: time since last wash
definition: Specification of the time since last wash

label: hydrocarbon type produced
definition: Main hydrocarbon type produced from resource (i.e. Oil, gas, condensate, etc). If other is specified, please propose entry in additional info field

label: relative air humidity
definition: Partial vapor and air pressure, density of the vapor and air, or by the actual mass of the vapor and air

label: basin name
definition: Name of the basin (e.g. Campos)

label: current vegetation method
definition: Reference or method used in vegetation classification

label: genetic modification
definition: Genetic modifications of the genome of an organism, which may occur naturally by spontaneous mutation, or be introduced by some experimental means, e.g. specification of a transgene or the gene knocked-out or details of transient transfection

label: special diet
definition: Specification of special diet; can include multiple special diets

label: dominant hand
definition: Dominant hand of the subject

label: pregnancy
definition: Date due of pregnancy

label: absolute air humidity
definition: Actual mass of water vapor - mh20 - present in the air water vapor mixture

label: host common name
definition: Common name of the host, e.g. Human

label: field name
definition: Name of the hydrocarbon field (e.g. Albacora)

label: history/previous land use
definition: Previous land use and dates

label: douche
definition: Date of most recent douche

label: surface humidity
definition: Surfaces: water activity as a function of air and material moisture

label: birth control
definition: Specification of birth control medication used

label: history/previous land use method
definition: Reference or method used in determining previous land use and dates

label: reservoir name
definition: Name of the reservoir (e.g. Carapebus)

label: sample capture status
definition: Reason for the sample
valueSyntax: [active surveillance in response to an outbreak|active surveillance not initiated by an outbreak|farm sample|market sample|other]

label: IHMC medication code
definition: Can include multiple medication codes

label: air temperature
definition: Temperature of the air at the time of sampling

label: sample disease stage
definition: Stage of the disease at the time of sample collection, e.g. inoculation, penetration, infection, growth and reproduction, dissemination of pathogen.

label: history/crop rotation
definition: Whether or not crop is rotated, and if yes, rotation schedule

label: hydrocarbon resource original temperature
definition: Original temperature of the hydrocarbon resource

label: menopause
definition: Date of onset of menopause

label: surface temperature
definition: Temperature of the surface at the time of sampling

label: host taxid
definition: NCBI taxon id of the host, e.g. 9606

label: depth (TVDSS) of hydrocarbon resource temperature
definition: True vertical depth subsea (TVDSS) of the hydrocarbon resource where the original temperature was measured (e.g. 1345 m)

label: history/agrochemical additions
definition: Addition of fertilizers, pesticides, etc. - amount and time of applications

label: HRT
definition: Whether subject had hormone replacement theraphy, and if yes start date

label: hysterectomy
definition: Specification of whether hysterectomy was performed

label: hydrocarbon resource original pressure
definition: Original pressure of the hydrocarbon resource

label: surface moisture pH
definition: ph measurement of surface

label: host subject id
definition: A unique identifier by which each subject can be referred to, de-identified, e.g. #131

label: history/tillage
definition: Note method(s) used for tilling

label: host age
definition: Age of host at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on species and study, e.g. Could be seconds for amoebae or centuries for trees

label: gynecological disorder
definition: History of gynecological disorders; can include multiple disorders

label: depth (TVDSS) of hydrocarbon resource pressure
definition: True vertical depth subsea (TVDSS) of the hydrocarbon resource where the original pressure was measured (e.g. 1578 m )

label: building occupancy type
definition: The primary function for which a building or discrete part of a building is intended to be used

label: history/fire
definition: Historical and/or physical evidence of fire

label: surface moisture
definition: Water held on a surface

label: host life stage
definition: Description of life stage of host

label: urogenital disorder
definition: History of urogenital disorders, can include multiple disorders

label: history/flooding
definition: Historical and/or physical evidence of flooding

label: permeability
definition: Measure of the ability of a hydrocarbon resource to allow fluids to pass through it. (Additional information: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Permeability_(earth_sciences))

label: dew point
definition: The temperature to which a given parcel of humid air must be cooled, at constant barometric pressure, for water vapor to condense into water.

label: history/extreme events
definition: Unusual physical events that may have affected microbial populations

label: porosity
definition: Porosity of deposited sediment is volume of voids divided by the total volume of sample

label: host sex
definition: Physical sex of the host

label: host disease status
definition: List of diseases with which the host has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. The value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from do (disease ontology) at http://www.disease-ontology.org, other hosts are free text

label: lithology
definition: Hydrocarbon resource main lithology (Additional information: http://petrowiki.org/Lithology_and_rock_type_determination). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field

label: horizon
definition: Specific layer in the land area which measures parallel to the soil surface and possesses physical characteristics which differ from the layers above and beneath
valueSyntax: [O horizon|A horizon|E horizon|B horizon|C horizon|R layer|Permafrost]

label: horizon method
definition: Reference or method used in determining the horizon

label: depositional environment
definition: Main depositional environment (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Depositional_environment). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
valueSyntax: [Continental - Alluvial|Continental - Aeolian|Continental - Fluvial|Continental - Lacustrine|Transitional - Deltaic|Transitional - Tidal|Transitional - Lagoonal|Transitional - Beach|Transitional - Lake|Marine - Shallow|Marine - Deep|Marine - Reef|Other - Evaporite|Other - Glacial|Other - Volcanic|other]

label: host body habitat
definition: Original body habitat where the sample was obtained from

label: hydrocarbon resource geological age
definition: Geological age of hydrocarbon resource (Additional info: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Period_(geology)). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field

label: oil water contact depth
definition: Depth of the original oil water contact (OWC) zone (average) (m TVDSS)

label: indoor space
definition: A distinguishable space within a structure, the purpose for which discrete areas of a building is used

label: host body site
definition: Name of body site where the sample was obtained from, such as a specific organ or tissue (tongue, lung etc...). For foundational model of anatomy ontology (fma) (v 4.11.0) or Uber-anatomy ontology (UBERON) (v releases/2014-06-15) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/FMA or http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/UBERON

label: water content method
definition: Reference or method used in determining the water content of soil

label: formation water salinity
definition: Original formation water salinity (prior to secondary recovery e.g. Waterflooding) expressed as TDS

label: indoor surface
definition: Type of indoor surface

label: host body product
definition: Substance produced by the body, e.g. Stool, mucus, where the sample was obtained from. For foundational model of anatomy ontology (fma) or Uber-anatomy ontology (UBERON) terms, please see https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/fma or https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/uberon

label: smoker
definition: Specification of smoking status

label: host total mass
definition: Total mass of the host at collection, the unit depends on host

label: sulfate in formation water
definition: Original sulfate concentration in the hydrocarbon resource

label: filter type
definition: A device which removes solid particulates or airborne molecular contaminants
valueSyntax: [particulate air filter|chemical air filter|low-MERV pleated media|HEPA|electrostatic|gas-phase or ultraviolet air treatments]

label: host height
definition: The height of subject

label: host HIV status
definition: HIV status of subject, if yes HAART initiation status should also be indicated as [YES or NO]

label: pooling of DNA extracts (if done)
definition: Indicate whether multiple DNA extractions were mixed. If the answer yes, the number of extracts that were pooled should be given

label: vfa in formation water
definition: Original volatile fatty acid concentration in the hydrocarbon resource

label: heating and cooling system type
definition: Methods of conditioning or heating a room or building
valueSyntax: [radiant system|heat pump|forced air system|steam forced heat|wood stove]

label: host length
definition: The length of subject

label: storage conditions (fresh/frozen/other)
definition: Explain how and for how long the soil sample was stored before DNA extraction

label: substructure type
definition: The substructure or under building is that largely hidden section of the building which is built off the foundations to the ground floor level

label: drug usage
definition: Any drug used by subject and the frequency of usage; can include multiple drugs used

label: source rock kerogen type
definition: Origin of kerogen. Type I: Algal (aquatic), Type II: planktonic and soft plant material (aquatic or terrestrial), Type III: terrestrial woody/ fibrous plant material (terrestrial), Type IV: oxidized recycled woody debris (terrestrial) (additional information: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kerogen). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field

label: host body-mass index
definition: Body mass index, calculated as weight/(height)squared

label: link to climate information
definition: Link to climate resource

label: building setting
definition: A location (geography) where a building is set

label: host diet
definition: Type of diet depending on the host, for animals omnivore, herbivore etc., for humans high-fat, meditteranean etc.; can include multiple diet types

label: source rock lithology
definition: Lithology of source rock (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Source_rock). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field

label: major diet change in last six months
definition: Specification of major diet changes in the last six months, if yes the change should be specified

label: mean annual temperature
definition: Mean annual temperature

label: light type
definition: Application of light to achieve some practical or aesthetic effect. Lighting includes the use of both artificial light sources such as lamps and light fixtures, as well as natural illumination by capturing daylight. Can also include absence of light

label: host last meal
definition: Content of last meal and time since feeding; can include multiple values

label: source rock depositional environment
definition: Source rock depositional environment (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Source_rock). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field

label: sample size sorting method
definition: Method by which samples are sorted; open face filter collecting total suspended particles, prefilter to remove particles larger than X micrometers in diameter, where common values of X would be 10 and 2.5 full size sorting in a cascade impactor.

label: weight loss in last three months
definition: Specification of weight loss in the last three months, if yes should be further specified to include amount of weight loss

label: mean seasonal temperature
definition: Mean seasonal temperature

label: host growth conditions
definition: Literature reference giving growth conditions of the host

label: source rock geological age
definition: Geological age of source rock (Additional info: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Period_(geology)). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field

label: host substrate
definition: The growth substrate of the host

label: mean annual precipitation
definition: The average of all annual precipitation values known, or an estimated equivalent value derived by such methods as regional indexes or Isohyetal maps.

label: space typical state
definition: Customary or normal state of the space

label: IHMC ethnicity
definition: Ethnicity of the subject

label: production start date
definition: Date of field's first production

label: production rate
definition: Oil and/or gas production rates per well (e.g. 524 m3 / day)

label: mean seasonal precipitation
definition: The average of all seasonal precipitation values known, or an estimated equivalent value derived by such methods as regional indexes or Isohyetal maps.

label: typical occupant density
definition: Customary or normal density of occupants

label: host family relationship
definition: Relationships to other hosts in the same study; can include multiple relationships

label: host occupation
definition: Most frequent job performed by subject

label: host infra-specific name
definition: Taxonomic information about the host below subspecies level

label: presence of pets or farm animals
definition: Specification of presence of pets or farm animals in the environment of subject, if yes the animals should be specified; can include multiple animals present
expectedValue: presence status;type of animal or pet

label: link to classification information
definition: Link to digitized soil maps or other soil classification information

label: water production rate
definition: Water production rates per well (e.g. 987 m3 / day)

label: occupancy at sampling
definition: Number of occupants present at time of sample within the given space

label: occupant density at sampling
definition: Average number of occupants at time of sampling per square footage

label: host infra-specific rank
definition: Taxonomic rank information about the host below subspecies level, such as variety, form, rank etc.

label: travel outside the country in last six months
definition: Specification of the countries travelled in the last six months; can include multiple travels

label: water cut
definition: Current amount of water (%) in a produced fluid stream; or the average of the combined streams

label: soil_taxonomic/FAO classification
definition: Soil classification from the FAO World Reference Database for Soil Resources. The list can be found at http://www.fao.org/nr/land/sols/soil/wrb-soil-maps/reference-groups

label: address
definition: The street name and building number where the sampling occurred.

label: twin sibling presence
definition: Specification of twin sibling presence

label: soil_taxonomic/local classification
definition: Soil classification based on local soil classification system

label: injection water fraction
definition: Proportion of the produced fluids derived from injected water at the time of sampling. (e.g. 87%)

label: host genotype
definition: Observed genotype

label: adjacent rooms
definition: List of rooms (room number, room name) immediately adjacent to the sampling room

label: soil_taxonomic/local classification method
definition: Reference or method used in determining the local soil classification

label: host phenotype

label: host body temperature

label: soil type

label: study completion status
definition: Specification of study completion status, if no the reason should be specified
expectedValue: YES or NO due to (1)adverse event (2) non-compliance (3) lost to follow up (4)other-specify

label: injection water breakthrough date of specific well
definition: Injection water breakthrough date per well following a secondary and/or tertiary recovery

label: amount of light
definition: The unit of illuminance and luminous emittance, measuring luminous flux per unit area

label: host dry mass
definition: Measurement of dry mass

label: lung/pulmonary disorder
definition: History of pulmonary disorders; can include multiple disorders

label: soil type method
definition: Reference or method used in determining soil series name or other lower-level classification

label: biocide administration
definition: List of biocides (commercial name of product and supplier) and date of administration

label: host blood pressure diastolic

label: lung/nose-throat disorder
definition: History of nose-throat disorders; can include multiple disorders

label: biocide administration method
definition: Method of biocide administration (dose, frequency, duration, time elapsed between last biociding and sampling) (e.g. 150 mg/l; weekly; 4 hr; 3 days)

label: slope gradient
definition: Commonly called 'slope'. The angle between ground surface and a horizontal line (in percent). This is the direction that overland water would flow. This measure is usually taken with a hand level meter or clinometer

label: architectural structure
definition: An architectural structure is a human-made, free-standing, immobile outdoor construction

label: host blood pressure systolic
definition: Resting systolic blood pressure, measured as mm mercury

label: blood/blood disorder
definition: History of blood disorders; can include multiple disorders

label: slope aspect
definition: The direction a slope faces. While looking down a slope use a compass to record the direction you are facing (direction or degrees); e.g., nw or 315 degrees. This measure provides an indication of sun and wind exposure that will influence soil temperature and evapotranspiration.

label: average daily occupancy
definition: Daily average occupancy of room

label: chemical treatment
definition: List of chemical compounds administered upstream the sampling location where sampling occurred (e.g. Glycols, H2S scavenger, corrosion and scale inhibitors, demulsifiers, and other production chemicals etc.). The commercial name of the product and name of the supplier should be provided. The date of administration should also be included

label: average dew point
definition: The average of dew point measures taken at the beginning of every hour over a 24 hour period on the sampling day

label: host color
definition: The color of host

label: chemical treatment method
definition: Method of chemical administration(dose, frequency, duration, time elapsed between administration and sampling) (e.g. 50 mg/l; twice a week; 1 hr; 0 days)

label: profile position
definition: Cross-sectional position in the hillslope where sample was collected.sample area position in relation to surrounding areas

label: corrosion rate at sample location
definition: Metal corrosion rate is the speed of metal deterioration due to environmental conditions. As environmental conditions change corrosion rates change accordingly. Therefore, long term corrosion rates are generally more informative than short term rates and for that reason they are preferred during reporting. In the case of suspected MIC, corrosion rate measurements at the time of sampling might provide insights into the involvement of certain microbial community members in MIC as well as potential microbial interplays

label: average temperature
definition: The average of temperatures taken at the beginning of every hour over a 24 hour period on the sampling day

label: host shape
definition: Morphological shape of host

label: drainage classification
definition: Drainage classification from a standard system such as the USDA system

label: sample well name
definition: Name of the well (e.g. BXA1123) where sample was taken

label: host pulse
definition: Resting pulse, measured as beats per minute

label: texture
definition: The relative proportion of different grain sizes of mineral particles in a soil, as described using a standard system; express as % sand (50 um to 2 mm), silt (2 um to 50 um), and clay (<2 um) with textural name (e.g., silty clay loam) optional.

label: bathroom count
definition: The number of bathrooms in the building

label: gravidity
definition: Whether or not subject is gravid, and if yes date due or date post-conception, specifying which is used

label: amniotic fluid/gestation state

label: well identification number

This is part of the Global Framework for Well Identification initiative which is compiled by the Professional Petroleum Data Management Association (PPDM) in an effort to improve well identification systems. (Supporting information: https://ppdm.org/ and http://dl.ppdm.org/dl/690)

expectedValue: measurement value or measurement value range

label: ceiling finish material

label: sample measured depth
definition: In non deviated well, measured depth is equal to the true vertical depth, TVD (TVD=TVDSS plus the reference or datum it refers to). In deviated wells, the MD is the length of trajectory of the borehole measured from the same reference or datum. Common datums used are ground level (GL), drilling rig floor (DF), rotary table (RT), kelly bushing (KB) and mean sea level (MSL). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field

label: microbial biomass
definition: The part of the organic matter in the soil that constitutes living microorganisms smaller than 5-10 micrometer. If you keep this, you would need to have correction factors used for conversion to the final units

(source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Total_acid_number)
